美国联邦通信委员会希望 SpaceX 放弃其在 2020 年 12 月的反向拍卖中获得的 8.8551 亿美元宽带资金的一部分。SpaceX 的 Starlink 卫星宽带部门是 FCC 农村数字机会基金 (RDOF) 的最大赢家之一在 Ajit Pai 作为 FCC 主席的最后一个完整月中宣布的拨款。总体而言，Pai 的 FCC 在 10 年内向全国 180 名竞标者提供了 92 亿美元（每年 9.2 亿美元），SpaceX 计划在 10 年内获得 8.8551 亿美元，用于为 35 个州的部分家庭和企业提供服务。 Pai 显然对拍卖的管理不善，因为代理主席杰西卡·罗森沃塞尔 (Jessica Rosenworcel) 办公室昨天宣布​​，FCC 必须“清理该计划在 2020 年被采用后的设计问题”。美国联邦通信委员会援引“有关该计划准备为停车场和服务良好的城市地区提供宽带资金的投诉”。美国联邦通信委员会建议 SpaceX 在大约 6% 的人口普查区块中放弃其计划获得资金的资金。其他 ISP 被要求放弃一小部分资金。 Pai 为第一次 RDOF 拍卖制定的规则要求资金仅用于人口普查区块，没有提供商提供 25Mbps 和 3Mbps 的速度。计划中的第二阶段拍卖将针对这些地区，但第一次拍卖仅针对完全没有服务的地方。 Rosenworcel 的办公室昨天致函数十名中标者，暗示他们自愿放弃部分资金。给 SpaceX 的信因其数量众多的人口普查区块而引人注目——在 34 个州约有 6,500 个——美国联邦通信委员会正在挑战 SpaceX 的资金。这 6,500 个是 SpaceX 暂时获得 FCC 拨款的大约 113,900 个人口普查区块之一。给 SpaceX 和其他 ISP 的信件指出“农村数字机会基金拍卖中包含的某些区域已经由一个或多个提供 25/3Mbps 宽带服务的服务提供商提供服务，或者以其他方式引起对浪费性支出的严重担忧，例如停车很多和国际机场。”您有责任进行尽职调查，以确保您能够履行农村数字机会基金的公共利益义务。本信函随附一份与您的长式申请相关的中标所涵盖的人口普查区块列表，以及已提出此类问题的地区。我们建议您评估这些领域的现有服务是否会影响您满足所有计划要求和部署里程碑的能力。
如果您确定不再为任何中标投标寻求支持，请立即向 Auction904@fcc.gov 发送电子邮件，指明具体的人口普查区块组，并简要说明您对投标违约的决定。违约将通过公告公布。我们昨天就 FCC 的信件联系了 SpaceX，如果得到回复，我们将更新这篇文章。这些信件称，在“违约这些投标将通过……将稀缺的普遍服务资金用于最需要的地方来服务于公共利益”的情况下，FCC 将考虑免除“通常与违约相关的处罚”。 FCC 可以采取行动阻止资金和惩罚不自愿撤回投标的 ISP。甚至在 Pai 进行拍卖之前，Rosenworcel 就敦促他推迟向 ISP 发放赠款，直到委员会完成一项计划，以创建更准确的地图，准确显示已部署和未部署宽带的位置。 FCC 当前的数据只是衡量每个人口普查区块中有多少 ISP，而没有显示任何特定地址是否有服务。 Pai 领导的 FCC 拍卖显然在人口普查区块层面甚至没有把事情做好，因为 FCC 现在表示大量资金被授予了错误的领域。总体而言，FCC 向 ISP 发送了 197 封信函，这些信函需要评估是否继续追求所有中标。一些 ISP 收到了许多不同运营部门的信件。例如，Charter 在近 20 个州收到了信件，共列出了大约 300 个受到质疑的人口普查区块。查特获得的资金甚至比 SpaceX 还要多——12.2 亿美元，为 24 个州的 106 万个家庭和企业提供服务——所以它没有被要求放弃很大一部分。 CenturyLink、Frontier、Cox 和 Windstream 都收到了来自几个州的信件。美国联邦通信委员会表示已准备好授权释放 92 亿美元的未决资金中的 3.11 亿美元，称这将使 48 家互联网服务提供商“在未来 10 年内为近 200,000 个家庭和企业带来 1Gbps 的宽带速度”。此处列出了这些 ISP。由美国联邦通信委员会运营的 RDOF 和其他普遍服务计划由美国人通过对电话费征收的费用来支付。
消费者权益保护组织 Free Press 的研究是促成 FCC 拍卖清理工作的催化剂之一。正如我们在 12 月所写的那样，Free Press 发现“Starlink 获得的近 13% 的资金（1.11 亿美元）用于在城市地区提供服务”。其中包括“美国联邦通信委员会被破坏的系统认为有资格获得奖励的大量城市地区”，例如亚特兰大、芝加哥、丹佛、纽约市、西雅图、拉斯维加斯、纽瓦克、迈阿密等主要机场附近的地点，波士顿、明尼阿波利斯-圣保罗、劳德代尔堡-好莱坞、底特律和费城。正如 Free Press 所指出的，SpaceX 还在“泽西城目标商店”等地方获得了资金；芝加哥“有豪华酒店”的人口普查区；哥伦比亚特区附近的“空停车场、草地和高速公路隔离带”； “迈阿密海滩市中心的停车场，离海滩两个街区，四周环绕着多家提供千兆服务的公司”；旧金山的一条街道“与金门公园南缘接壤”，“五角大楼外的一个停车场”。 Free Press 撰写了一个由六部分组成的系列文章，标题为“光纤到会所：Pai 为富人提供宽带补贴”。自由新闻研究主任德里克·特纳 (Derek Turner) 昨天赞扬了 FCC 的行动。特纳说：“为了在离职前为这个计划赢得荣誉，阿吉特·派（Ajit Pai）无视早期的批评，并迅速向埃隆·马斯克（Elon Musk）等人提供资金，因为他们为任何人建造了宽带桥梁。 “Pai 想对一个糟糕的过程表示敬意。在 Rosenworcel 的领导下，FCC 似乎决心进行 Pai 跳过的尽职调查，以确保联邦资金实际上将真实的人——而不是交通中位数——连接到负担得起的服务。” Rosenworcel 一直在没有民主党多数席位的情况下领导联邦通信委员会，因为总统乔拜登仍然没有提名另一位专员来打破民主党和共和党之间的 2-2 僵局。昨天 FCC 的声明令一群反对其他 ISP 的资助奖励的农村宽带提供商感到高兴。该组织称自己为确保 RDOF 诚信联盟，此前曾在 FCC 文件中批评过许多 RDOF 资金奖励。 “FCC 的这些补救措施只是开始揭示几个 RDOF 应用程序的潜在问题，”该组织的法律顾问鲍勃·西尔弗曼 (Bob Silverman) 在昨天的新闻稿中表示。在早些时候提交的文件中，该组织敦促联邦通信委员会“确保资金不会流向无法使用的地方，例如停车场、游乐场、灌木丛、生锈的丙烷罐等。”共和党和民主党国会议员也对资金可能流向无法兑现承诺的互联网服务提供商表示担忧。失去部分 FCC 资金应该不会对 Starlink 网络建设产生太大影响。与有线 ISP 不同，Starlink 将能够在公司发射的数千颗低地球轨道卫星中的任何地方提供服务。 Starlink 的主要限制是它可以在每个地理区域服务的客户数量，但这是由于网络容量限制而不是资金问题。 Starlink 的技术最适合人口稀少的地区。
也可能不会对未来的 Starlink 客户产生任何重大影响。 SpaceX 没有承诺在 FCC 资助的地区收取更低的价格。为了满足要求，它所要做的就是在受资助的人口普查区块中以指定的速度提供服务，无论是否有 FCC 资助，它都可能会这样做。 SpaceX 首席执行官埃隆马斯克已承诺覆盖全球 Starlink，并表示该公司有望在 Starlink 达到“完全正现金流”之前向其投资 50 亿至 100 亿美元。 FCC 发布命令，阻止固定无线提供商 LTD Broadband 在三个州获得的资金。 FCC 还阻止为佛罗里达州的一家公司提供资金。美国联邦通信委员会表示，它“不会容忍任何不认真提供宽带服务或没有做出适当努力来获得州批准的计划的提供商”，因此“拒绝了佛罗里达州 AB Indiana 和加利福尼亚州 LTD Broadband 的请求，俄克拉荷马州和堪萨斯州放弃计划截止日期，因为他们未能及时采取行动寻求州认证。”美国联邦通信委员会表示，它将很快发布公告，“发现 AB Indiana 在佛罗里达州的投标违约，LTD 在加利福尼亚、堪萨斯州和俄克拉荷马州的投标违约。” LTD 已获得 13.2 亿美元，用于为 15 个州的 528,088 个地点提供服务。该公司还收到一封信，质疑其在 3,100 多个人口普查区块中的资金。当 Ars 联系到 LTD 首席执行官 Corey Hauer 时，他拒绝置评。披露：拥有Charter 13% 股份的Advance/Newhouse Partnership 是Advance Publications 的一部分。 Advance Publications 拥有 Condé Nast，后者拥有 Ars Technica。
note_en:
The Federal Communications Commission wants SpaceX to give up a portion of the $885.51 million in broadband funding it was awarded in a  reverse auction in December 2020.
 SpaceX's Starlink satellite broadband division was one of the biggest winners in the FCC's Rural Digital Opportunity Fund (RDOF) grants announced in Ajit Pai's last full month as FCC chairman. Overall, Pai's FCC awarded $9.2 billion over 10 years ($920 million per year) to 180 bidders nationwide, with SpaceX slated to get $885.51 million over 10 years to serve homes and businesses in parts of 35 states.
 Pai apparently mismanaged the auction, as an  announcement yesterday from Acting Chairwoman Jessica Rosenworcel's office said the FCC has to "clean up issues with the program's design originating from its adoption in 2020." The FCC cited "complaints that the program was poised to fund broadband to parking lots and well-served urban areas." The FCC suggested that SpaceX give up its funding in about 6 percent of the census blocks where it's slated to get money. Other ISPs are being asked to give up smaller portions of their funding.
  The rules that Pai set for the first RDOF auction required funding to go only to census blocks where no providers offer speeds of 25Mbps down and 3Mbps up. A planned Phase 2 auction would target such areas, but the first auction was meant only for places that are completely unserved.
 Rosenworcel's office sent  letters to dozens of winning bidders yesterday, suggesting that they voluntarily give up a portion of their funding. The letter to SpaceX stands out for the sheer number of census blocks—about 6,500 in 34 states—where the FCC is challenging SpaceX's funding. Those 6,500 are among about 113,900  census blocks where SpaceX tentatively won FCC grants.
 The letters to SpaceX and other ISPs pointed to concerns "that certain areas included in the Rural Digital Opportunity Fund auction are already served by one or more service providers that offer 25/3Mbps broadband service or otherwise raise significant concerns about wasteful spending, such as parking lots and international airports."
  It is your responsibility to conduct due diligence to ensure that you can meet the Rural Digital Opportunity Fund public interest obligations. Attached to this letter is a list of census blocks covered by winning bids associated with your long-form application and where such concerns have been raised. We recommend that you assess whether existing service in these areas will affect your ability to meet all program requirements and deployment milestones.
 If you determine that you will no longer pursue support for any of your winning bids, promptly send an email to Auction904@fcc.gov identifying the specific census block groups with a brief explanation of your decision to default on your bid. Defaults will be announced by public notice.
 We contacted SpaceX about the FCC letter yesterday and will update this article if we get a response.
 The letters say the FCC will consider waiving "penalties normally associated with defaults" in cases where "defaulting on these bids will serve the public interest by... targeting scarce Universal Service funds to where they are needed most." The FCC could take action to block funding and penalize ISPs that don't voluntarily withdraw their bids.
  Even before Pai conducted the auction, Rosenworcel  urged him to delay awarding grants to ISPs until the commission completes a plan to create a more accurate map showing exactly where broadband has and hasn't been deployed. The FCC's current data simply measures how many ISPs are in each census block without showing whether any specific address has service. The Pai-led FCC auction apparently didn't even get things right at the census-block level, as the FCC now says that a significant amount of the funding was awarded to the wrong areas.
 Overall, the FCC sent 197 letters to ISPs that need to evaluate whether to keep pursuing all of their winning bids. Some ISPs received a bunch of letters for different operating divisions. For example, Charter got letters in nearly 20 states, listing a total of about 300 challenged census blocks. Charter had won even more funding than SpaceX—$1.22 billion to serve 1.06 million homes and businesses in 24 states—so it isn't being asked to give up a significant percentage. CenturyLink, Frontier, Cox, and Windstream all received letters in several states.
 The FCC said it is ready to authorize the release of $311 million of the $9.2 billion in pending funding, saying this will let 48 ISPs "bring 1Gbps broadband speeds to nearly 200,000 homes and businesses over the next 10 years." Those ISPs are  listed here.
 The RDOF and other universal service programs run by the FCC are paid for by Americans through fees imposed on phone bills.
  Research by consumer-advocacy group Free Press was one of the catalysts that led to the FCC's auction cleanup effort. Free Press found that "nearly 13 percent of the money awarded to Starlink—$111 million—is to provide service in urban areas," as we  wrote in December. That included "a large number of  very urban areas that the FCC's broken system deemed eligible for awards," such as locations at or adjacent to major airports in Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, New York City, Seattle, Las Vegas, Newark, Miami, Boston, Minneapolis-Saint Paul, Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood, Detroit, and Philadelphia.
 As Free Press noted, SpaceX also won funding in places such as "the Jersey City Target store"; census blocks "with luxury hotels" in Chicago; "empty parking lots, grassy fields and highway medians" near the District of Columbia; a "parking garage in downtown Miami Beach, two blocks from the beach, surrounded on all sides by multiple companies offering gigabit service"; a street in San Francisco "that borders the southern edge of Golden Gate Park," and "a parking lot outside the Pentagon." Free Press wrote a  six-part series titled, "Fiber to the Clubhouse: Pai Subsidizes Broadband for the Rich."
  Free Press Research Director Derek Turner  praised the FCC's action yesterday. "In a rush to take credit for this program before his departure, Ajit Pai ignored early criticism and rapidly awarded money to the likes of Elon Musk for building broadband bridges to nobody," Turner said. "Pai wanted to put a pretty bow on a bad process. Under Rosenworcel, the FCC seems determined to do the due diligence that Pai skipped to ensure that federal money actually connects real people—as opposed to traffic medians—to affordable services."
 Rosenworcel has been leading the FCC without a Democratic majority as  President Joe Biden still hasn't nominated another commissioner to break the 2-2 deadlock between Democrats and Republicans.
 Yesterday's FCC announcement pleased a group of rural broadband providers that objected to other ISPs' funding awards. The group calls itself the Ensuring RDOF Integrity Coalition and had previously criticized many of the RDOF funding awards in an FCC  filing. "These remedial actions by the FCC only begin to reveal the underlying problems of several RDOF applications," the group's counsel, Bob Silverman, said in a press release yesterday. In its earlier filing, the group urged the FCC to "ensure that funding does not go to unserviceable locations such as parking lots, playgrounds, shrubbery, rusted-out propane tanks and the like."
 Republican and Democratic members of Congress also  raised concerns about funding potentially going to ISPs that can't deliver on their promises.
  Losing a portion of the FCC funding shouldn't have much effect on the Starlink network buildout. Unlike wired ISPs, Starlink will be able to offer service just about anywhere from the thousands of low-Earth-orbit satellites the company is launching. The primary limit for Starlink is the number of customers it can serve in each geographic region, but that's due to  network-capacity constraints rather than funding problems. Starlink's technology is best-suited for sparsely populated areas.
 There probably won't be any significant impact on future Starlink customers, either. SpaceX didn't promise to charge lower prices in FCC-funded areas. All it has to do to meet the requirement is offer service at specified speeds in the funded census blocks, which it would likely do with or without FCC funding. SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has promised global Starlink coverage and  said the company is on track to invest $5 billion to $10 billion in Starlink before it reaches a "fully positive cash flow."
  The FCC issued an  order blocking the funding that fixed-wireless provider  LTD Broadband won in three states. The FCC is also blocking funding for a company in Florida.
 The FCC said it "will not tolerate any provider participating in the program that is not serious about providing broadband service or has not made appropriate efforts to secure state approvals," and thus "rejected requests from AB Indiana in Florida and LTD Broadband in California, Oklahoma, and Kansas to waive program deadlines, in light of their failure to act in a timely way to seek state certification." The FCC said it will soon issue a public notice "finding AB Indiana in default on its bids in Florida and LTD in default on its bids in California, Kansas and Oklahoma."
 LTD had been awarded $1.32 billion to serve 528,088 locations in 15 states. The company also received a letter challenging its funding in over 3,100 census blocks. LTD CEO Corey Hauer declined to comment when contacted by Ars.
 Disclosure: The Advance/Newhouse Partnership, which owns 13 percent of Charter, is part of Advance Publications. Advance Publications owns Condé Nast, which owns Ars Technica.
title: Ajit Pai 显然管理不善 90 亿美元的基金——新的 FCC 老板开始“清理”
title_en: Ajit Pai apparently mismanaged $9 billion fund—new FCC boss starts “cleanup”

一群动视暴雪员工计划在周三举行“平等罢工”，以抗议“我们作为员工的价值观没有准确反映在我们领导层的言行中”的感觉。此举是在加州公平就业和住房部提起诉讼，指控该公司存在广泛的歧视性做法之后做出的。此前，该公司做出了官方回应，称数千名员工在一份签名的请愿书中称“对我们认为公司应该代表的一切表示憎恶和侮辱”。罢工组织者在一份声明中表示，他们要求管理层与他们合作制定新的招聘做法，公布员工工资率，并进行第三方审计，以改善员工多样性并防止骚扰。目前，组织者写道，“女性，尤其是有色人种女性和跨性别女性、非二元性女性以及其他容易受到性别歧视的边缘群体”在招聘、薪酬和晋升方面受到不公平歧视，并受到其他员工的骚扰。 .罢工组织还寻求“终止强制性仲裁条款”，“保护施虐​​者并限制受害者寻求赔偿的能力”。该声明回应了 150 名 Riot Games 员工的核心需求，他们在 2019 年英雄联盟制造商试图通过仲裁解决 2018 年员工因性骚扰和薪酬差距提起的诉讼后离职。此案后来在没有使用仲裁的情况下庭外和解。暴雪员工此前曾在 2019 年离职，以抗议该公司对一名发表亲香港言论的炉石玩家的处理方式。去年，许多暴雪员工分发了一份电子表格，分享他们的薪水和加薪，以强调员工之间的薪酬差距以及与高薪高管的比较。组织者敦促员工从太平洋夏令时间上午 10 点开始聚集在暴雪园区外（由于 COVID 健康限制）。他们要求那些无法亲自参加的人“[停止]工作并[分享]他们在社交媒体上的参与情况，并使用#ActiBlizzWalkout标签。”其他工作室的成员被鼓励团结一致和/或向一些多元化和反暴力慈善机构捐款。动视暴雪员工的有组织行动是在 Game Workers Unite (GWU) 正式启动三年多之后开始在行业内公开推动工会和劳工组织的活动。这一努力导致了瑞典 Paradox Interactive 和 Nexon Korea 的国际开发者工会得到认可，并且在承包商之间成功地罢工了一个视觉小说制造商。但是，北美的任何主要游戏开发商都没有成功的工会努力。 GWU 联合创始人兼 CODE 主要组织者 Emma Kinema 去年告诉 Ars：“劳工组织只是需要时间，无论您是在组织小型咖啡店、杂货店还是大型跨国科技公司。” “这是个人的、一对一的、基于对话的工作，需要时间、耐心和同理心。第一批公开活动将会到来。”鉴于上周动视暴雪公司及其法律顾问就 DFEH 诉讼发表的声明，以及 Frances Townsend 随后发表的内部声明，以及动视暴雪现任和前任员工自那以后分享的许多故事，我们相信我们的价值观因为员工没有在我们领导层的言行中得到准确反映。
作为目前的动视暴雪员工，我们正在举行罢工，呼吁执行领导团队与我们合作满足以下要求，以改善公司员工的条件，尤其是女性，尤其是有色人种和跨性别女性、非二元人以及其他边缘化群体。终止当前和未来所有员工合同中的强制性仲裁条款。仲裁条款保护施虐者并限制受害者寻求赔偿的能力。采用招聘、面试、雇用和晋升政策，旨在提高各级员工的代表性，并在全公司范围内的多元化、公平和包容性组织中得到员工的同意。当前的做法导致女性，尤其是有色人种女性和跨性别女性、非二元性人群和其他容易受到性别歧视的边缘化群体，与男性相比，他们没有被公平地聘用担任新角色。公布公司所有性别和种族员工的相对薪酬（包括股权授予和利润分享）、晋升率和工资范围的数据。当前的做法导致上述群体没有得到公平的报酬或晋升。授权全公司的多元化、公平和包容性工作组聘请第三方来审计 ABK 的报告结构、人力资源部门和执行人员。必须确定当前系统如何未能防止员工骚扰，并提出新的解决方案来解决这些问题。罢工详情 罢工将于 7 月 28 日星期三举行。从太平洋夏令时间上午 10 点到下午 2 点，我们将在暴雪校园的正门前见面。由于当前的 COVID 健康和安全措施，我们不会进入暴雪校园。停车应仅限于 5 号楼和 6 号楼区域（拉古纳峡谷路）的开放式停车场，因为没有门可以进入。无法亲自见面的员工可以通过停止工作并使用#ActiBlizzWalkout 标签在社交媒体上分享他们的参与情况来为罢工发声。如果您属于不同的工作室，请随时自定义主题标签：#(YourStudio)Walkout。
社区支持 我们感谢社区在这件事上与我们站在一起。请随时通过#ActiBlizzWalkout 和蓝心表情符号来提升标签。我们还将鼓励任何想与我们站在一起的人向以下慈善机构之一捐款。
note_en:
A group of Activision Blizzard employees is planning a "Walkout for Equality" on Wednesday to protest the feeling that "our values as employees are not being accurately reflected in the words and actions of our leadership."
  The move comes in the wake of  a California Department of Fair Employment and Housing lawsuit alleging widespread discriminatory practices at the company. It also comes after an official response from the company that thousands of employees have called "abhorrent and insulting to all that we believe our company should stand for"  in a signed petition. In a statement, walkout organizers said they're asking management to work with them to develop new recruiting practices, publish employee pay rates, and undertake third-party audits to improve staff diversity and prevent harassment. Currently, organizers write, "women, in particular women of color and transgender women, nonbinary people, and other marginalized groups that are vulnerable to gender discrimination" are subject to unfair discrimination in hiring, pay, and promotion and suffer from harassment from other employees.
 The walkout group also seeks "an end to mandatory arbitration clauses" that "protect abusers and limit the ability of victims to seek restitution." That statement echoes a core demand of 150 Riot Games employees who  walked out in 2019 after the   League of Legends maker tried to use arbitration to settle  a 2018 employees lawsuit over sexual harassment and pay disparities. The case was later  settled out of court without the use of arbitration.
 Blizzard employees  previously walked off the job in 2019 to protest  the company's handling of a  Hearthstone player who made pro-Hong-Kong statements. Last year, many Blizzard employees  circulated a spreadsheet sharing their salaries and raises in an effort to highlight pay disparities among the staff and  in comparison to highly paid executives.
    Organizers are urging employees to gather just outside the Blizzard campus (due to COVID health restrictions) starting at 10 am PDT. They are asking those who can't attend in person to "[stop] work and [share] their participation on social media with the #ActiBlizzWalkout hashtag." Members of other studios are being encouraged to walk out in solidarity and/or donate to a number of diversity and antiviolence charities.
 The organized action from Activision Blizzard employees comes more than three years after  the formal launch of Game Workers Unite (GWU) started its public push for unionization and labor organizing in the industry. That effort has led to recognized unions for international developers at  Sweden's Paradox Interactive and  Nexon Korea, as well as  a successful strike among contractors for one visual-novel maker. But there has yet to be a successful unionization effort at any major North American game developer.
  "Labor organizing simply takes time, whether you are organizing a small coffee shop, a grocery store, or a large multinational tech corporation," GWU co-founder and  CODE lead organizer Emma Kinema  told Ars last year. "It's personal, one-on-one, conversation-based work, and it takes time, patience, and empathy. And those first public campaigns will come."  Given last week’s statements from Activision Blizzard, Inc. and their legal counsel regarding the DFEH lawsuit, as well as the subsequent internal statement from Frances Townsend, and the many stories shared by current and former employees of Activision Blizzard since, we believe that our values as employees are not being accurately reflected in the words and actions of our leadership.
 As current Activision Blizzard employees, we are holding a walkout to call on the executive leadership team to work with us on the following demands, in order to improve conditions for employees at the company, especially women, and in particular women of color and transgender women, nonbinary people, and other marginalized groups.
 An end to mandatory arbitration clauses in all employee contracts, current and future. Arbitration clauses protect abusers and limit the ability of victims to seek restitution.
 The adoption of recruiting, interviewing, hiring, and promotion policies designed to improve representation among employees at all levels, agreed upon by employees in a company-wide Diversity, Equity & Inclusion organization. Current practices have led to women, in particular women of color and transgender women, nonbinary people, and other marginalized groups that are vulnerable to gender discrimination not being hired fairly for new roles when compared to men.
 Publication of data on relative compensation (including equity grants and profit sharing), promotion rates, and salary ranges for employees of all genders and ethnicities at the company. Current practices have led to aforementioned groups not being paid or promoted fairly.
 Empower a company-wide Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion task force to hire a third party to audit ABK’s reporting structure, HR department, and executive staff. It is imperative to identify how current systems have failed to prevent employee harassment, and to propose new solutions to address these issues.
 Walkout Details The walkout will take place on Wednesday, July 28th. From 10 AM-2 PM PDT, we’ll meet in front of the main gate of the Blizzard Campus. We will not enter the Blizzard Campus due to the current COVID health and security measures. Parking should be restricted to the open parking lot in the building 5 and 6 area (Laguna Canyon Road) as there is no gate to access it.
 Employees unable to meet in person may lend their voice to the walkout by stopping work and by sharing their participation on social media with the #ActiBlizzWalkout hashtag. If you belong to a different studio, please feel free to customize the hashtag: #(YourStudio)Walkout.
 Community Support We thank our community for standing with us on this. Please feel free to signal boost the hashtag #ActiBlizzWalkout, and by using the blue heart emoji. We would also encourage anyone who wants to stand in solidarity with us to donate to one of the following charities.
title: 动视暴雪“平等罢工”抗议管理层不作为
title_en: Activision Blizzard “Walkout for Equality” to protest management inaction

note_en:
Activison Blizzard employees are staging a walkout on Wednesday, July 28th in response to the company’s handling of sexual harassment allegations brought by the state of California. Employees will meet outside Blizzard’s main campus in Irvine at 10AM PST. “We believe that our values as employees are not being accurately reflected in the words and actions of our leadership,” the organizers said in a statement.
 The news comes after  California sued the renowned gaming studio and its publisher, saying women were subjected to constant sexual harassment and discrimination at work. One female employee allegedly died by suicide after having nude photos of her passed around the office. Following the suit,  numerous employees took to Twitter to detail additional examples of harassment and discrimination. Former Blizzard president Mike Morhaime also  issued a statement saying “I am extremely sorry that I failed you.”
 The company denied the allegations, saying the lawsuit was merely “irresponsible behavior from unaccountable State bureaucrats that are driving many of the State’s best businesses out of California.”
   An end to forced arbitration clauses in all employee contracts — a change  Google employees successfully fought for in 2019.
 New hiring and promotion processes to increase representation across the company. Employees say that “current practices have led to women, in particular women of color and transgender women, nonbinary people, and other marginalized groups that are vulnerable to gender discrimination not being hired fairly for new roles when compared to men.”
 The publication of salary and promotion data “for employees of all genders and ethnicities at the company.”
 Allow a diversity, equity, and inclusion task force to hire a third-party organization to audit the executive staff. “It is imperative to identify how current systems have failed to prevent employee harassment, and to propose new solutions to address these issues,” employees say.
 Employees who can’t attend the walkout in person are being asked to use the hashtag #ActiBlizzWalkout to lend their support online.
title: 动视暴雪员工在性骚扰诉讼后退出
title_en: Activision Blizzard employees to walk out following sexual harassment lawsuit

在 iOS 15 之前的设计中，标签栏位于屏幕顶部的传统位置，左侧是易于访问的阅读器模式按钮（双 A），右侧是重新加载按钮。在底部，您会找到前进和后退按钮、分享按钮、阅读列表和标签按钮。 iOS 15 设计取消了所有这些对常用功能的有用访问点，有利于标签栏的可访问性。相反，它使用了一个三点“更多”菜单来隐藏您在浏览网页时可能想做的所有其他事情——比如重新加载网站、共享链接、在阅读器模式下查看页面、保存文章以供稍后阅读，等等。结果，可以采取的行动清单增加到 20 多项。在 Apple 专家 John Gruber 的 The Talk Show 播客中，他指出，在 WWDC 上发布 Safari 之前的几周内，新设计甚至在 Apple 内部都不受欢迎。他声称，一些人的内部情绪是新设计可能看起来很酷，但并不是那么好用。 TechCrunch 的主编 Matthew Panzarino 作为嘉宾加入了 7 月 21 日的节目，他同意从理论上讲，减少屏幕上的内容是个好主意。但在实践中，它只是行不通。 “当你实际使用它时，你会意识到它实际上使屏幕更加混乱，并使其更加混乱，”他说。 “而且它不会给你更多的屏幕空间，除非你采取行动——比如滚动——这让它有点奇怪。”通过 Beta 4 更新，Apple 正试图解决由于其新 Beta 版的这一变化而引起的一些问题。首先，它在标签栏上重新添加了一个共享按钮，并在该菜单下放置了其他控件。共享链接可能是网络用户最常见的任务之一，因此将按钮放回只需轻轻一按即可使用的位置是有意义的。
刷新按钮现在永久显示在 iOS 15 Safari 地址栏中 #iOS15DevBeta4 pic.twitter.com/v8AoRB68QI 在域名旁边的标签栏中也再次有一个重新加载按钮，尽管与之前的版本相比它有点小。同时，当阅读器可用时，标签栏中会出现一个阅读器模式按钮，只需轻轻一按即可访问。当您与网站上的按钮交互时，标签栏现在也会最小化。之前，它已经成为障碍，导致网站按钮无法访问的可用性问题。又是一天无法订购外卖，因为 iOS 15 Safari 的底部栏使此结帐按钮无法点击。 Apple 指出，iPadOS 15 用户将能够在默认的单独标签栏设计或紧凑标签栏之间进行选择。 Apple 并不是第一个尝试以这种方式重新思考移动浏览器设计的公司。
前 Google Chrome 设计经理 Chris Lee 最近写了一篇文章，介绍了他对 Chrome 移动浏览器进行类似重新设计的工作，该浏览器带有一个底部 URL 栏，Google 最终决定从不推出该浏览器。他说，这些变化当时也收到了不同的反应。他解释说，新设计在科技界获得了狂热追随者，但主流用户发现这些变化“令人迷惑”。使用与 Safari 一样频繁启动的应用程序可以增强肌肉记忆力。尽管您可能喜欢栏的位置（我最初喜欢！），但随着时间的推移，您可能会发现，当您想要做的不仅仅是访问网站或在选项卡之间滑动时，这些更改变得更加困难。在记住不要到达屏幕顶部以获取各种操作的快捷方式时，也有一个学习曲线。 Safari 更新是新 Beta 版本带来的几项调整之一，其中还包括一种与选定联系人共享焦点状态的方式、新的 XL 小部件尺寸（iPad 上的 Apple Podcasts 正在使用）以及其他较小的更新。
note_en:
In the pre-iOS 15 design, the tab bar sits in its traditional spot at the top of the screen, with an easy-to-access Reader Mode button (the double A’s) on the left and the reload button on the right. At the bottom, you’d find the forward and back buttons, a share button, reading list and tabs buttons.
  The iOS 15 design did away with all these useful access points to commonly used features, favoring the reachability of the tab bar over everything else. Instead, it used a three-dot “more” menu to hide everything else that you may want to do when browsing the web — like reload the website, share a link, view the page in Reader Mode, save an article to read later, and and so on. The list of actions that could be taken grew to over 20 items long, as a result.
 On Apple pundit John Gruber’s  The Talk Show podcast, he noted the new design wasn’t even popular inside Apple in the weeks leading up to the Safari announcement at WWDC. The internal sentiment among some was that the new design may look cool, but wasn’t all that usable, he claimed.
 TechCrunch’s Editor-in-Chief Matthew Panzarino, who had joined as a guest on the July 21 episode, agreed that in theory, the idea of having less on the screen was a good idea. But in practice, it just didn’t work.
 “When you actually use it, you realize that it actually clutters the screen more and makes it a little more confusing,” he said. “And it doesn’t give you much more screen real estate unless you take action — like scrolling — which makes it kind of weird.”
 With the beta 4 update, Apple is trying to fix some of the issues that arose from this change in its new betas.
 For starters, it has re-added a Share button to the tab bar, and put additional controls under that menu. Sharing links it probably one of the most-common tasks for web users, so it makes sense to put the button back in a place where it only takes one tap to use.
 The Refresh button is now permanently showing in the iOS 15 Safari address bar  #iOS15DevBeta4  pic.twitter.com/v8AoRB68QI
 There’s also once again a reload button in the tab bar next to the domain name, though it’s a bit smaller compared with prior versions.
 Meanwhile, a Reader Mode button will appear in the tab bar when Reader is available, and it can be accessed with just one tap.
 The tab bar will also now minimize when you’re interacting with buttons on websites. Before, it had gotten in the way, causing usability issues where website buttons remained unreachable.
 Just another day being unable to order takeout because iOS 15 Safari’s bottom bar makes this checkout button untappable.
 iPadOS 15 users will be able to choose between the separate tab bar design, which is the default, or the Compact tab bar, Apple noted.
 Apple isn’t the first to try to rethink the mobile browser design in this way.
 A former Google Chrome design manager,  Chris Lee,  recently wrote about his work on a similar redesign for the Chrome mobile browser with a bottom URL bar that Google ultimately decided never to launch. He said the changes had also received mixed reactions at the time. The new design had gained a cult following in the tech community but mainstream users found the changes “disorienting,” he explained.
 There is something to be said for the muscle memory with using an app that’s launched as frequently as Safari is. Although you may like the placement of the bar (I initially did!), over time, you may find that the changes made it more difficult when you wanted to do more than simply visit a website or swipe between tabs. And there’s a learning curve when it comes to remembering not to reach for the top of the screen for the shortcuts to various actions, too.
 The Safari update is  one of several tweaks arriving with the new beta releases, which also include a way to share focus status with select contacts, a new XL widget size (which Apple Podcasts on iPad is using), and other, smaller updates.
title: 苹果在最新测试版中调整了有争议的 iOS 15 Safari 更改
title_en: Apple tweaks controversial iOS 15 Safari changes in latest beta

哈佛大学备受争议的天文学家 Avi Loeb 正在领导一项名为伽利略计划的新计划，以检查地球的天空和太阳系的其余部分，寻找外星智慧的迹象。这位长期的天文学教授因相信星际物体 Oumuamua 可能是外星探测器而闻名，他在周一的虚拟新闻发布会上宣布了他的计划细节。正式地，该计划被描述为“一项透明的科学项目，旨在推进系统的实验搜索，以寻找潜在的天文考古文物或由假定存在或已灭绝的外星技术文明 (ETC) 制造的活跃技术设备的交叉验证证据。”翻译：计划是使用各种望远镜寻找外星飞船、探测器或其他不是地球上出生的智能生物留下的碎片。 “我们在天空中看到的东西不是政客或军事人员应该解释的，因为他们没有接受过科学家的培训，”勒布告诉记者。 “这是由科学界来弄清楚......基于我们将作为科学家收集的非政府数据。”该项目的第一阶段包括在全球范围内建立一个由数十个相对较小的望远镜组成的网络，这些望远镜将尝试捕捉未识别的空中现象的新图像（UAP，旨在取代“UFO”的新近受欢迎且更具包容性的首字母缩写词）。美国国家情报总监 6 月份发布的一份备受期待的报告证实了一些 UAP 的存在，军事和情报界对此无法提供一定的解释。
一份声明中写道：“伽利略计划的目标是将偶然或轶事观察和传说中对地外技术特征的搜索带入透明、经过验证和系统的科学研究的主流。”为此，该计划将专注于收集新的数据和观察结果，而不是像最近的 DNI 报告中包含的那样分析过去的 UAP 目击事件。然后，新数据将通过算法和人工智能进行分析，以尝试将真正的 UAP 与鸟类、气球、无人机、卫星和其他已知解释区分开来。该项目的联合创始人、哈佛大学的访问化学生物学学者、科学仪器制造商布鲁克的首席执行官弗兰克·劳基恩指出，伽利略项目不会考虑对新的 UAP 观测提供任何基于物理学的替代解释。 “我们将在科学上坚持已知的物理学，但会提供数据，”劳基恩说。勒布已成为天文学界的一个两极分化的人物，特别是自从他今年早些时候发表概述他的 Oumuamua 假说的书以来，许多科学家指责他在没有适当证据的情况下妄下结论。 lmao 大多数科学家不会忽视这些类型文明的可能存在（宇宙是巨大的！），但大多数人不会在没有非凡证据的情况下跳出非凡的主张，而勒布喜欢这样做。 https://t.co/BvhLFqh7Ea — 👾 Justin Cowart 👾 (@jccwrt) 2021 年 7 月 26 日
“大多数科学家并没有忽视这些类型文明的可能存在（宇宙是巨大的！），”贾斯汀考沃特博士说。研究火星地​​质学的候选人周一发推文。 “但大多数人不会在没有非凡证据的情况下提出非凡的主张，而勒布喜欢这样做。”勒布拒绝接受“非凡的主张需要非凡的证据”这一前提，但仍希望通过他的新项目收集一些信息。事实上，在项目名称中对伽利略的点头是对他的批评者的一种回击，将其与著名的 16 世纪天文学家进行了比较，后者因当时异端的建议地球围绕太阳而不是相反而被监禁。除了试图在天空中发现 UAP 之外，该项目还计划使用下一代望远镜，如即将到来的 Vera C. Rubin 天文台，在太阳系中寻找更多像 Oumuamua 这样的天体，以及潜在的围绕地球运行的外星探测器以低调的方式检查我们。该项目的描述甚至为设计自己的专用太空天文台留下了可能性：“我们将概念化和设计，可能与感兴趣的太空机构或太空企业合作，一个准备发射的太空任务，以成像不寻常的星际物体，例如作为 Oumuamua，通过拦截他们接近太阳的轨迹或使用地面勘测望远镜发现星际流星。”从实验室到您的收件箱。每周从 CNET 获取最新的科学故事。所有这些都是一个潜在的昂贵提议。勒布告诉记者，过去两周他在哈佛的研究基金收到了总额超过 175 万美元的捐款，“没有任何附加条件”。他说，希望将资金水平提高至少十倍，“以完成更严格的研究”。
至于我们什么时候可以看到伽利略项目提供的新 UAP 图像，勒布说，该团队正在选择望远镜，并希望在来年展示“有趣的结果”。关注 CNET 的 2021 年太空日历，了解今年所有最新的太空新闻。您甚至可以将其添加到您自己的 Google 日历中。
